case_vignette:
An 8-year-old boy presents to the clinic for evaluation of a progressively worsening nail dystrophy that began a few months ago. The patient’s mother denies a family history of skin diseases and reports that her son has no history of medical problems. On physical examination, all of the boy’s fingernails and toenails show hyperkeratosis, longitudinal ridging, loss of luster, and roughness. His hair, skin, and oral mucosa are unremarkable. Nail biopsy reveals spongiotic changes and exocytosis of inflammatory cells into the nail epithelia. The results of a fungal culture are negative. The patient’s mother reports that her son has been taking a multivitamin supplement for the least 6 months. The patient’s mother is concerned that the multivitamin may be causing the nail dystrophy.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My fingernails and toenails are rough, have lost their shine, and have developed thickening and ridges.
How long have you been experiencing these nail changes?
I've been experiencing these nail changes for a few months.
Do you have any other symptoms, such as joint pain or a rash?
No, I don't have any other symptoms like joint pain or a rash. My hair, skin, and mouth all look normal.
Have you had any recent illnesses or infections?
No, I have no history of medical problems.
Are there any similar cases of nail problems in your family?
No, there is no family history of skin diseases.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
Yes, I have been taking a multivitamin supplement for the last 6 months.
Have you been exposed to any harsh chemicals or experienced any trauma to your nails?
No, there has been no exposure to harsh chemicals or trauma to my nails.
Final Diagnosis: Onychorrhexis

The patient has no history of medical problems and no family history of skin diseases. They have been taking a multivitamin supplement for the last 6 months. There has been no exposure to harsh chemicals or trauma to their nails.
